definition: Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: What is the objective In terms of education in the "three Character Classic"?
sentences.chinese: 那《三字經》當中，它的教育目標是什麼？

sentences.english: China's San Zi Jing in history had a wide popularity in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，中國的《三字經》曾在日本廣爲流傳。

sentences.english: After perfect training, students are proposed to read aloud the whole part of the course without Chinese Pinyin.
sentences.chinese: 熟練以後朗讀沒有拼音的《漢語快學三字經全文》。

sentences.english: Features and the embedded "lies in the different records."
sentences.chinese: 特點就在於和《三字經》各有偏重。

sentences.english: Thus, it is plausible to determine that the author of the Three-Character Canon was Wang Yinglin.
sentences.chinese: 因此，說《三字經》的作者爲宋人王應麟，料無大謬。

sentences.english: Here the author analyses the aesthetic beauty deeply on The Three Word Primer .
sentences.chinese: 本文作者就《英韻三字經》之美進行了細緻剖析。

definition: to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
